title: Bat Radar & Self-Driving Cars
subtitle: How nature's original aviators inspired the sensors of the future.
description: How LiDAR and Ultrasonic sensors 'see' the world using the same physics as bats.

content.biological_inspiration: Bats emit ultrasonic chirps and analyze the returning echoes to map their environment in total darkness.
content.technical_equivalent: Ultrasonic sensors use piezoelectric transducers, while LiDAR uses pulsed laser light to measure 'Time of Flight'.
content.engineering_principle: Time of Flight (ToF) calculations for distance mapping.
content.coding_logic: Point cloud generation and emergency braking algorithms based on proximity thresholds.
